sentences.sentence: And other reflections on the fight over America's debt ceiling.Listen to and follow 'Matter of Opinion'Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Amazon MusicTime is running out for Congress to pass legislation lifting the debt ceiling.
The United States is just days away from defaulting on its obligations, which would cause global economic chaos.
A deal seems likely to pass, but given that the deadline was no mystery, why did it take until the last moment?
How should we have tough conversations about our nation's spending?
And is it inevitable that we will find ourselves in this situation again?Thoughts?
Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.comor leave us a voice mail message at (212) 556-7440.

We may use excerpts from your message in a future episode.By leaving us a message, you are agreeing to be governed by ourreader submission termsand agreeing that we may use and allow others to use your name, voice and message.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” was produced this week by Sophia Alvarez Boyd, Phoebe Lett and Derek Arthur.
It was edited by Stephanie Joyce.
Original music by Isaac Jones, Carole Sabouraud and Pat McCusker.
Fact-checking by Kate Sinclair and Michelle Harris.
Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.
The executive producer of New York Times Opinion Audio is Annie-Rose Strasser.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; photograph via Getty FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: And other reflections on the fight over America’s debt ceiling.Listen to and follow ‘Matter of Opinion’Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Amazon MusicTime is running out for Congress to pass legislation lifting the debt ceiling. The United States is just days away from defaulting on its obligations, which would cause global economic chaos. A deal seems likely to pass, but given that the deadline was no mystery, why did it take until the last moment? Is there a better strategy? How should we have tough conversations about our nation’s spending? And is it inevitable that we will find ourselves in this situation again?Thoughts? Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.comor leave us a voice mail message at (212) 556-7440. We may use excerpts from your message in a future episode.By leaving us a message, you are agreeing to be governed by ourreader submission termsand agreeing that we may use and allow others to use your name, voice and message.Follow our hosts on Twitter: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT), Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT) and Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen).“Matter of Opinion” was produced this week by Sophia Alvarez Boyd, Phoebe Lett and Derek Arthur. It was edited by Stephanie Joyce. Mixing by Carole Sabouraud. Original music by Isaac Jones, Carole Sabouraud and Pat McCusker. Fact-checking by Kate Sinclair and Michelle Harris. Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski. Special thanks to Allison Benedikt. The executive producer of New York Times Opinion Audio is Annie-Rose Strasser.PHOTO:  (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; photograph via Getty FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)
